summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General Investigations Division transcription request form for an audio interview conducted on August 5, 2021, related to case number 2019010614. The form details administrative approval and cost information for transcribing a 27-minute, 56-second interview, resulting in a 49-page transcript.

events.title: Audio Interview Conducted
events.description: An audio interview was conducted, lasting 27 minutes and 56 seconds, which is the subject of this transcription request.

events.title: Transcription Request Approved by SAC/ASAC
events.description: The transcription request for the August 5 interview was approved by the Office SAC/ASAC.

events.title: Transcription Request Approved by INV/HQ
events.description: The transcription request received final approval from INV/HQ.

events.title: Transcription Received
events.description: The completed transcription was certified as received.

keyFacts: The document is a DOJ OIG transcription request form for case number 2019010614, which is likely related to the Epstein investigation.
An audio interview was conducted on August 5, 2021, and its transcription resulted in a 49-page document.
The transcription process involved multiple levels of approval within the DOJ OIG Investigations Division, indicating formal procedural oversight.
The actual cost for transcription was $141.61, exceeding the estimated cost of $121.38.
The subject of the interview recording is not named on the form, as the 'Full Name of Recording Subject' field is not filled in.
